DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [ST]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Mode [RM]
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius and switch it to heat mode?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The thermostat accepts a Set Temperature command with a parameter between 10.0 and 30.0 °C, and a Set Mode command with enumerated values including Heat. The requested temperature 22 °C is within the allowed range, and Heat mode is valid.

Step 1: Use Set Temperature [ST] with parameter 22.0 °C.
Step 2: Use Set Mode [SM] with parameter Heat [1].

Result: Execute ST(22.0) to set target temperature to 22 °C and SM(Heat) to switch mode to heat.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: Kitchen Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 3 Unit level
        Off [0]
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 3 Unit level
    Enable Oscillation [EO]
    Disable Oscillation [DO]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power [RP]
    Report Speed [RS]
    Report Oscillation [RO]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the kitchen fan, set the speed to medium, and enable oscillation.

I analyze the device structure: the fan has Power Status (Off/On), Speed Level (0-3), and Oscillation (Enabled/Disabled). Commands include Turn On, Turn Off, Set Speed with parameter 0-3, Enable Oscillation, and Disable Oscillation.

Step 1: Turn On the fan using Turn On [TON].
Step 2: Set Speed to Medium, which corresponds to level 2, using Set Speed [SS] with parameter 2.
Step 3: Enable Oscillation using Enable Oscillation [EO].

Result: Send TON to power on, SS(2) to set medium speed, and EO to enable oscillation.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Can you brighten the bedroom light and set its color temperature to 5000 Kelvin?

Reviewing the device structure, the bedroom smart light has properties Status (0-100%), Color Temperature (2700-6500 K), and Brightness (0-100%). Commands include Brighten [BRT] (no parameters) and Set Color Temperature [SCT] with a parameter between 2700 and 6500 K.

Step 1: Use Brighten [BRT] to increase brightness.
Step 2: Use Set Color Temperature [SCT] with parameter 5000 K, which is within the allowed range.

Result: Send BRT command to brighten the light and SCT(5000) to set color temperature to 5000 K.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OD]
    Close Door [CD]
    Lock Door [LD]
    Unlock Door [UD]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDS]
    Report Lock Status [RLS]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked, and can you open it if it is unlocked?

First, I check the properties: Door Status can be Closed, Open, Opening, or Closing; Lock Status can be Locked or Unlocked.

To answer if the door is locked, I would query the Lock Status property.

If the door is unlocked (Lock Status = Unlocked), then the Open Door command [OD] can be sent to open the door.

Conclusion: If the garage door is unlocked, send OD to open it; otherwise, inform the user it is locked and cannot be opened remotely.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

***Device***
Name: Outdoor Sprinkler System
  ***Properties***
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit L/min
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [SZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit zone
    Stop Zone [SPZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 5 Unit zone
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Flow Rate [RFR]
    Report Zone Status [RZS]
    Report Schedule Status [RSS]

USER QUERY:
Please start watering zone 3 and enable the schedule for the sprinkler system.

Analyzing the device structure, the sprinkler system has properties Water Flow Rate (0-20 L/min), Zone Status (On/Off), and Schedule Enabled (True/False).

Commands include Start Zone [SZ] and Stop Zone [SPZ] with zone parameters 1 to 5, and Enable Schedule [ES] and Disable Schedule [DS].

Step 1: Start watering zone 3 by sending Start Zone [SZ] with parameter 3.
Step 2: Enable the schedule by sending Enable Schedule [ES].

Result: Execute SZ(3) to start zone 3 and ES to enable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the water heater and set the target temperature to 55 degrees Celsius?

Reviewing the device structure, the water heater has Current Temperature (20-80 °C), Target Temperature (30-70 °C), Power Status (On/Off), and Energy Consumption (0-10 kWh).

Commands include Turn On [TON], Turn Off [TOF], and Set Target Temperature [STT] with parameter 30-70 °C.

Step 1: Turn on the water heater using Turn On [TON].
Step 2: Set the target temperature to 55 °C using Set Target Temperature [STT] with parameter 55.

Result: Send TON to power on and STT(55) to set target temperature to 55 °C.

  ***Send Commands***

    Report Energy Used [REU]

USER QUERY:
What is the current power usage and voltage reading from the energy monitor?

The device properties include Current Power Usage (0-5000 W) and Voltage (100-240 V). The device can send reports for power usage and voltage via Report Power Usage [RPU] and Report Voltage [RV].

To get the current power usage and voltage, request these reports.

Result: Send RPU to get current power usage and RV to get voltage reading from the energy monitor.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

USER QUERY:
I want to set the front door light to 75% brightness with a ramp rate of 1.0 minute and enable the backlight at 50%. Also, please make it beep.

The front door light has properties Status and On Level (both 0-100%), Ramp Rate with multiple enumerated time options including 1.0 minute, and Backlight (0-100%). Commands include On [DON] with brightness parameter, Ramp Rate [RR] with enumerated values, Backlight [BL] with percentage, and Beep [BEEP] with enumerated parameters.

Step 1: Set the light On level to 75% using On [DON] with parameter 75.
Step 2: Set Ramp Rate to 1.0 minute using Ramp Rate [RR] with parameter corresponding to 1.0 minute (which is enum 12).
Step 3: Set Backlight to 50% using Backlight [BL] with parameter 50.
Step 4: Send Beep [BEEP] command (parameter unspecified, so default beep).

Result: Send DON(75), RR(12), BL(50), and BEEP commands to achieve the requested settings.

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the bathroom fan at speed level 3 and set a timer for 30 minutes?

The bathroom exhaust fan has properties Power (On/Off), Speed (0-5 levels), and Timer (0-120 minutes). Commands include Turn On [TON], Turn Off [TOF], Set Speed [SS] with parameter 0-5, and Set Timer [ST] with parameter 0-120 minutes.

Step 1: Turn on the fan using Turn On [TON].
Step 2: Set speed to level 3 using Set Speed [SS] with parameter 3.
Step 3: Set timer to 30 minutes using Set Timer [ST] with parameter 30.

Result: Send TON to power on, SS(3) to set speed, and ST(30) to set timer.

USER QUERY:
Please open the window shade halfway and tilt it to 30 degrees.

The smart window shade has Position (0-100%), Tilt Angle (-90 to 90 degrees), and Battery Level (0-100%). Commands include Set Position [SP] and Set Tilt [ST] with respective ranges.

Step 1: Set Position to 50% (halfway open) using Set Position [SP] with parameter 50.
Step 2: Set Tilt Angle to 30 degrees using Set Tilt [ST] with parameter 30.

Result: Send SP(50) to open halfway and ST(30) to tilt the shade to 30 degrees.
